dublin_core.dcvalue: RapidSMS is a mobile phone-based technology being used throughout Rwanda to improve community maternal and child health. This tool helps CHWs track womenâ€™s antenatal care visits, identify women at risk, refer them to health facilities, and improve communication with the facilities in the event of an emergency.
Community health worker or volunteer, Facility, Public sector health system (national, regional, district)

Randy Wilson, Team Lead: Research, M&E and KM, Rwanda Health Systems Strengthening Project, Management Sciences for Health, rwilson@msh.org. Erick Gaju, eHealth Department Director, Ministry of Health, Rwanda, erick.gaju@moh.gov.rw

Data collection and reporting, Electronic decision support, Financial transactions and incentives, Registries and vital events tracking, Child health, Malaria and other vector-borne diseases, Maternal health, Newborn heath
